intro: Sinosenecio savatieri, commonly known as the Savatieri's sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
